definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia
to make an in-app purchase in a game

sentences.english: The movie begins with Superman’s failed search for Krypton.
sentences.chinese: 电影以超人寻找氪星人失败开场。

sentences.english: After they are sealed up, krypton and argon gasses are pumped into the space in between.
sentences.chinese: 当它们被密封之后，就向其中注入氪气和氩气。
氪星的大恶棍，说来话长。

sentences.english: A combination of the moon's solar reflection. And the energy-storage capacity of kryptonian skin cells.
sentences.chinese: 月亮反射的太阳光，结合氪星球皮肤细胞储存的能量。

sentences.english: We believe everyone has the powers of Superman, the guy from the Planet Krypton.
sentences.chinese: 我们相信每个人都可以像来氪星人超人那样强大无比。

sentences.english: Xenon and krypton are not retained by the body so they have little effect.
sentences.chinese: 氙和氪不能在人体内停留所以对人体影响很小。

sentences.english: Because of its lower effective nuclear charge, xenon is more easily oxidized than krypton.
sentences.chinese: 因为氙的有效荷电荷较低，所以氙比氪容易被氧化。

definition: to make an in-app purchase in a game
tax levied on a conquered people by an army/fee for a divination session/variant of 氪金[ke4 jin1], in-app purchase (gaming)
player (of a game)/enthusiast (audio, model planes etc)
to draw a prize/a lottery/a raffle
